org.apparatus_templi.web

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.web.AbstractWebServer
      • org.apparatus_templi.web.WebServer

  • public class WebServer
extends AbstractWebServer
    A simple web server that acts as both a middle man between the Coordinator and any front ends, as well as a host for the bundled web front end. The web server is implemented as a HttpServer and defines a series of HttpHandlers that handle requests for virtual documents.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson , Christopher Hagler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebServer()
      Starts the web server bound to the loopback interface
      WebServer(InetSocketAddress socket)
      Starts the web server bound to the first available port on the given InetSocketAddress

      Returns the String representation of the path of the web resources folder being used by this web server.

      Returns the String representation of the current server address.

      Returns the InetSocketAddress that the web server is attached to.

      Set the path of the web resource folder used by the front-end.
      void start()
      Starts the HttpServer or HttpsServer than underlies the web server
      void terminate()
      Notify the web server that it should terminate all current connections and exit its run() method.

      • WebServer

        public WebServer(InetSocketAddress socket)
          throws Exception
        Starts the web server bound to the first available port on the given InetSocketAddress
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket to bind the server to. If null then a new InetSocketAddress will be constructed based off the users preferences
        Throws:
        Exception

      • setResourceFolder

        public void setResourceFolder(String path)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Set the path of the web resource folder used by the front-end. This folder will be used as the top level for all resource requests.
        Specified by:
        setResourceFolder in class AbstractWebServer
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the website resources
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path is not a director, does not exists, or can not be opened.

        Returns the port number the server is bound to.

      • getServerLocation

        public String getServerLocation()
        Returns the String representation of the current server address. This address should either be \"localhost\" or an IP address (i.e. \"192.168.0.1\").
        Specified by:
        getServerLocation in class AbstractWebServer
        Returns:
        The String representation of the current address.

      • getProtocol

        public String getProtocol()
        Returns the protocol type
        Specified by:
        getProtocol in class AbstractWebServer
        Returns:
        one of "http://" or "https://"

      • getSocket

        public InetSocketAddress getSocket()
        Description copied from class: AbstractWebServer
        Returns the InetSocketAddress that the web server is attached to. Since some operating systems *cough* Windows *cough* do not like processes re-binding to the same port soon after a socket is closed this socket should be reused unless the host or port number will be changed.
        Specified by:
        getSocket in class AbstractWebServer

      • getResourceFolder

        public String getResourceFolder()
        Description copied from class: AbstractWebServer
        Returns the String representation of the path of the web resources folder being used by this web server. This value may be null if no resource folder has been set.
        Specified by:
        getResourceFolder in class AbstractWebServer
